title: @Riot Unintentional/Hidden Riven Buff in 6.20?
body:
https://twitter.com/scarra/status/783796215506874368

The new attack animation canceling help has made Riven a lot easier to play apparently. Its way easier to animation cancel combo with her atm. 

One person responding to Scarra notes that this has happened before "at least 4 other times when you guys have re coded auto attacks".

People that dont never play her say they will play her in their high elo games now. Can we have some feedback or thoughts on this? Riven recently got a decently sized buff on her ult, and now this too?

replies.body: Unintentional change from the sounds of it. We've got a couple of folks looking at it at the moment.
Still wish she had more build diversity or requirements than Rush BC then Maw or YGB would help a bit for those facing her
having more option for item choices seems like a increase in difficulty for her enemy.

its more that BC has become the same as brutalizer used to be but just so much better. From what I have seen of late BC may just be so far over tuned its not fun to fight most champions who use it. The 30% ARM reduction on a champion that can apply it all in under a full second is what I equate to the cause of my frustration. Very few other champions can apply it so quickly and get as many bonuses from it. Having watched some matches of challenger Riven players who are 0/3 and then get BC which allows them to then get even in score in no time it's not very fun to watch, As Some Riven players have pointed out on reddit its not uncommon for Riven to oneshot someone under tower with little gold advantage and not receive much damage from the event unless the champion has easy access Hard CC. The reason I brought this up is that she has a I finish this item first no matter who I am fighting because it has no downsides for her due to her designed kit. It gives every stat she wants in the game for 3100g while also giving her a bonus stat of HP which she enjoys for the fact of it allows her more tankyness. Its either too cost efficient, or the way she scales with the little it gives is too much. Cuting out the CDR on it would help but that may hurt other lower tier champions that rely on it too much is the issue. 

These are just my thoughts on it, as playing against a riven who rushes the item makes any Armour purchase you made to fight her null once she finishes it.

Point me to matches where they go 0-3 against an enemy top laner then get BC and suddenly turn things around without help from team. I would be very interested in seeing that. From what I've seen (Adrian and Dekar), if a Riven goes 0-3 top lane, that Riven is expected to be a non-factor in the game. A riven "one shotting someone under tower" means they have flat armor pen runes and/or flat armor pen items (ghost blade, dusk blade, maw) and are killing a squishy champion with little armor. That's exactly what a Talon would do to a squishy champion by building armor pen, so I'm not sure why you would expect differently out of a Riven who is itemizing similarly. That's what a Fizz will do to a squishy with "just" Lich Bane. 

"Lower tier champions"? What? You mean MF, Jayce (the good jayce players rush BC too), Lucian, etc. who all rely on it? MF having the highest ADC win rates while Jayce and Lucian being very popular in competitive.  All the while Riven has a balanced win rate and is not played competitively. BC provides MANY champions with "no downsides" (no downsides is arguable, because that gold spent on BC could have been spent on something else such as ghostblade or maw depending on the situation). How is armor shred, HP, movement speed, CDR, attack damage not as useful on MF, Jayce, Lucian, Zed, Wukong, Talon, Garen, Varus, etc.? 

Also, armor does not suddenly become null with BC. That would mean that just by buying Lord Dominik's ADCs have made tanking worthless so there's no longer a reason to build tanky in this meta.

That is like every Riven game, she may not be able to kill you because you obviously have a gold lead and might counter her in some way, but the rest of your team is in serious danger once she finishes BC. Every game I have played against a Riven goes one of two ways lately:  

*  She gets incredibly fed and there is pretty much nothing the other team can do aside from 1v5ing her and sacrificing at least 2 people.  
*  She gets destroyed in lane, so she goes to a different lane(s) and feeds of them until your only option is to 1v5 her... 

The reason is because she snowballs so freakin hard, once she gets BC shit hits the fan. Part of that is because I am at low elo and no one knows how to do anything, but right now she can be completely overwhelming. I never have any issue against her until my team starts chain feeding her, happens every time because she just goes bot lane, dives them both and is guaranteed at least one kill.

Riven may have a lot but not a balanced winrate. 
By far.
Ty for the quick response!
She needs to be disabled atm. Being able to frontload that much damage with basically no counterplay is fucking absurd.

Since when is winning when you're more skilled at a champion than an average player a bad thing? Riven's kit is not overloaded at all. Having high mobility, an AD-scaling shield and 2 short CC abilities may sound overloaded on paper, but it works completely differently in-game. If you're unable to finish before late game (sometimes even midgame if just one enemy is fed), one single CC ability can nuke her, which in turn forces her to play smart instead of just smashing your keyboard until you get a kill.

Riven can also get countered very hard, and can almost never win lane on her own vs most popular toplaners in the hands of an average player, ever since the masteries changed, which means less snowball from her side and higher chance of losing the game. I believe this is pretty balanced.

Until we see some kind of LEGITIMATE reason for this to be fixed, it should not be. No other champion is gated behind some roundabout backwards broken combat style that you have to put in 10x more time to learn than other champs. People who say the riven shouldn't have animation cancelling are wrong, because gutting the only way for a champ to be viable is a stupid and illogical idea. Might as well take annies stun away and vaynes silver bolts away too? leave it as is for the time being and if this really affects winrate that much then yes, nerf it. but until she is above 55% winrate then i see no reason. As someone who is put hundreds of games into Riven the way she feels after the change not only lets less experienced players actually enjoy playing the champion but give them a way to actually play the champion like everyone else. The idea that a champ should only be accessible to the elite players is both selfish and toxic, and the main reason why riven players have the stigma they have. You can't play the champion without getting shit on by your teammates, something that doesn't happen to any other champ. This is the riven change that has been needed for years and "fixing" something that isnt broken is one of this games biggest flaws.
